intro: Onobrychis peduncularis var. maura, commonly known as the purple vetch, is a leguminous plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It has a creeping growth habit with nodules on its roots that host nitrogen-fixing bacteria. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to improve soil fertility.
